metadata.title: CVE-2017-9061 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 4.7.5, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists when attempting to upload very large files, because the error message does not properly restrict presentation of the filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
